name: thicker
text: This is my favorite strip.

name: drsprinkl
text: i used this strip as the defining evidence in my case against my homies bloatee  (as well as a similar discussion from an ep of venture bros.). i think the dude was devestated to see himself mirrored as the chubby cartoon cat to the T. needless to say, it was hastily removed thereafter

name: unquotable
text:
"A beard is no excuse for a chin line!"

A chubby for you.

name: mc_white
text: Ray is totally the Pied Piper of Tight Asses.

name: tekende
text: It's "not a substitute for a jawline" but yeah

name: undyingsong
text:
No matter how you trim it!

Great tip.

name: mira
text:
"dude of gravity"
awesome

name: snatch22
text:
That thing is so hell of wispy, a spider covets.
I cannot brook the gossamer bloatee.

My goal in life is to be able to talk like that.

name: zeroasalimit
text: Roast Beef - the king of banter.

name: dotacreepy
text: snooooooooreeeeee

name: farqussus
text: It should have been opbvious, but it wasn't. Is the point.

name: nurdbot
text: And yet, we never see the thing again...

name: seven47
text: A comment left by seven47 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, Nurdbot, shockofsputnik, farqussus, STUART)

name: trevor
text: "Comb-over of the internet age"

name: cracklewater
text:
Nah, the baldness-pattern-eliminating shaved head is the comb-over of the 21st Century.

I might start rocking one soon.

name: epicurus
text: This strip has many great lines. "Dude of gravity" is classic and a good way of putting it. "OH HOW THE PEOPLE WILL MARCH" is lovely also.

name: lateadopter
text: I love the interaction between Ray and Roast Beef in this one.  They keep upping the sass level, and then Roast Beef gets that annoyed look at the end.  Onstad does wonders with eyebrows.

name: petitegitan
text:
And cats don't even have eyebrows.

The wonders never cease.

name: shogun
text:
Chubby for a comment in the style of "And dogs can't even play pool!" ("Aye! I know! And to think it goes against all the laws of nature!" "That's art. That's.....art....")

Always been a fan of that particular form. Kudos.

name: halfdirt
text: Chubby for just being you

name: straw
text: Chubby because that was awful nice of you, Stuart Smalley.

name: phy
text: They do have hair in the place where an eyebrow would be. It's just that it blends in with all the other hair. A cat is basically all eyebrow.

name: heccibiggs
text:
I think my cat has eyebrows. They're exactly lime his whiskers, only they come out from above his eye.

We've had him since I was two or three years old so I always assumed this was normal, but thinking about it... Maybe not...

I always knew that cat was the fucking devil.

name: quaga
text: well, to be fair, it is a cat.

name: tekende
text:
I have seen cats who have this as well.

I can't remember if my cat does (I haven't seen him in three or four weeks since he is staying with friends of the family, as I am currently living in a home in which my roommate owns three pit bulls).

name: spicyponyhead
text: My cat has eyebrow-whiskers too. I think it's normal. Well, as normal as a cat can be. WHICH IS NOT NORMAL AT ALL. Fuck.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: so i guess this strip reveals that Ray is of French descent?

name: hollis
text:
I think you're right... the only other place I've seen it mentioned is the strip in which he and Beef discuss diabetes and parking technique, but that comes later:
http://achewood.com/index.php?date=12162005

name: djwhiterabbit
text: A comment left by djwhiterabbit was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, tekende, Overmedicated, PeterK, STUART, Darthemed)

name: farqussus
text: His Uncle Culpepper was definitely of the Louisiana Southern Gentleman ilk. There's some blood there somewhere.

name: nathanielperson
text: Smuckles doesn't seem like a very French name. Maybe it's on his mom's side.

name: heyman
text: and Ramses Luther doesn't seem like much of a frenchman

name: tellumo
text: I believe it was originally pronounced "Smucklay," and that Ray's family was of Huguenot (Protestant French) extraction, thus making the middle name " Luther " somewhat common.

name: morypcaina
text: They were big on the Egyptians too, those Huguenots.

name: tellumo
text: Wasn't there some kind of vogue for Egyptian stuff in the 19th century? Maybe that became a family tradition or something, later on. (Yeah, kinda graspin' at straws here, but it could work.)

name: sirfrederick
text: I'd be willing to bet that his mother's side is the one of French extraction. Ramses Luther and Antonyne Cheops? Who can say? Perhaps some French, some African... the Huguenot theory interests me too.

name: ovenface
text: I think he's just making shit up to excuse his pathetic beard growing abilities

name: tellumo
text: This is also possible.

name: nutmeg
text: anything with or about beards is a favorite thing of mine. unsure as of why. maybe i've got a problem.

name: featurelessvoid
text: In a just world, there would be a "Dogg I cannot brook the gossamer bloatee" T-shirt.

name: presterjohn
text: A comment left by presterjohn was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Deusoma, Cypher, shakey)

name: featurelessvoid
text: No.  Just the "gossamer bloatee" one will suffice.

name: mercuri0us
text: Too bad no-one who sees you're t-shirt will have any idea what it means... or is that the point?

name: greenkoolayd
text: does anothers approval dictate YOUR clothing choices?

name: salvar
text: Yes. :(

name: morganization
text: A comment left by morganization was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, mr_lostman28, Connellingus)

name: darkwaffle
text: The words in this strip were ever so carefully worded. You can tell. You know this.

name: liquidcruelty
text:
GOD NO THERE IS A NAME FOR WHAT I DO, I am not sure whether to be ashamed that it is not fooling anyone or relieved that enough do it as to warrant a naming
Today begins my use of "brook" as a verb also

name: equinn2006
text: I often implore my friends and loved ones to listen to my drum song.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
hello, NOLAN...

*prepares to get either chubbied to the heavens or lamed into oblivion*

name: halfdirt
text: Prepare to be dildoed forty-seven times.

name: jackparsons
text:
Alt-text: How many cauliflower asses clenched in anger at panel 3? Be honest. It's the comb-over of the Internet age.

I am a dude of slight gravity and have a bloatee. It is bone white and my hair is still brown so I am hell of tutone. This prevents my lameness.

name: norrin
text: I have friends who sport the bloatee. I think that, while it is on par with the comb over as far as it's a way of trying to camoglauge a deficiency, it is different from the comb over in the sense that it does not look worse than the flaw it is trying to cover.

name: spinynorman
text: Ray's physical language in the second to last panel speaks more words than a novel could ever hope

name: jlowe424
text: ...a spider covets...

name: centipede_damascus
text: Ray thinks a bit of pot-belly is not a bad thing for a respectable man to have.

name: endoftheworld
text:
I had a goatee for a while that verged too close to bloatee for comfort. I wore it with pride for a while until a nasty girl in my hometown told me it made me look handsome because I looked "just like Toby Keith"

I have since banished it from my face.

name: falseprophet
text: Beef suffers no fashion decisions that are ephemeral in nature.

name: baryonyx
text: I would like an entire strip consisting of Ray slapping his upper thigh, and the people, in turn, marching.

name: omegatron
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: re5urgam
text: This is wonderful. I hope more people come back to 2005 to see this.

name: mattylite
text: Me too.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Apparently, I already chubbied this in the past, but I wish I could chubby it again. I've been laughing for several minutes now. They both look so intense.

name: sparhawk
text: It's a double edged sword, having a friend whose asscheeks are always so readily available for slapping...

name: gussiejives
text: Oh man, not the cauliflower ass!

name: direhaggis
text: What is that crazy ass pose Ray is doing in panel 1?

name: echidnaboy
text:
[IMGS OFF]
[IMGS OFF]

name: eidolem
text:
Oh man. I've been telling my BFF for years about the Fat Guy Goatee (the lesser name I assigned to the phenomenon) and she insisted that I was just being a bitch.

I was being a bitch ALSO.

name: skiddysmith
text:
Plus that thing is so hell of wispy a spider covets

HAH!

name: mustakrakesh
text: Dude, I cannot brook the drum song.

name: dumase
text:
Check out that bounce in Ray's step in the first panel.
Ray's drum song is a 24/7 event.

name: lancet
text: As a NorCal person I am annoyed every time I see "hell of" instead of hella. As in hella wispy. As in very wispy.

name: greenkoolayd
text:
what about a full-on beard?(i didnt think my neck was terribly indistinguishable, but who knows.... [[shrug]]

[IMGS OFF]

name: plummet
text:
NECKBEARD

NECK

BEARD

name: fineoakstructure
text: No, that's just a beard.  Sorry.

name: echidnaboy
text:
It's only a bloatee if it hides the fact that that you have no jawline, like so:
[IMGS OFF]

And, to help you imagine how George would look without it:
[IMGS OFF]

name: greenkoolayd
text: george lucas can certainly afford plastic surgery.  why the facade, george?  why the facade?

name: carlyle
text: Ray gets sassy...?

name: lynnym
text: Roast Beef's line in the 5th panel is possibly the best sentence ever.

name: wingspan
text: For some reason I always remember the last panel as "Oh, how the children will dance!"

name: dusty
text: What do you call it when they have a whole blob of neck fat with thin trimmed hair meant to disguise it as a big bushy beard? a Bloard?
